Description: Postcard; printed paper; shows the Golden Horn and Galata bridge at Constantinople; view taken from close to the Galata tower on Pera looking towards the old city.
Curator's comments: Used; dated 15th February, 1924. The inked message refers to how "This is a view of Constantinople with the famous Galata Bridge over the Golden Horn. Tomorrow we up ship & land at Alexandria & then to Palestine. Loving greetings to you & Mrs Morrison". The stamp indicates that it was posted from Egypt as it shows the twin seated colossi at Memphis.
